MajorClaims.MC1: a person should keep trying for his goals

Claims.C1: Anyone who wants to achieve the goal should acknowledge that his effort and experience from suffering helps him understand his true potential and increase his strength, and ultimately, it will prompt him to be ready for overcoming the greater challenge in his life
Claims.C2: committing to our goal helps creating personal worth
Claims.C3: one who learns the great difficulty will become stronger
Claims.C4: the responsibility is worthy of carrying
Claims.C5: the true reward is to have the dignity

Premises.P1: I realized the true potential of my body and mind as I decided to train myself hard
Premises.P2: Even if I were not to win this medal, I acknowledged the great amount of my endeavor as I could keep my tired legs running
Premises.P3: I remembered how I was suffered in the first round when I was last person who touched the line
Premises.P4: I did not give up, and believed that I would be better in the next round
Premises.P5: I knew how to improve myself
Premises.P6: I had been a loser for a thousand time before the first winning, and suffering from losing in each competition makes me stronger
Premises.P7: When the distance is longer and harder to achieve, a runner who can go beyond his limit will proud of himself
Premises.P8: He can feel the sweetness of triumph
Premises.P9: he did not stop pursing his goal
Premises.P10: we, as an average people, might feel that the responsibility to our goal is too heavy to carry on
